com.joliciel.talismane.utils

Class PerformanceMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.joliciel.talismane.utils.PerformanceMonitor

  • public class PerformanceMonitor
extends Object
    Monitors the performance of various sub-tasks within an application run.
    Configuration file keys:
    • talismane.monitoring.activated=true/false : whether the entire system is activated (default = false)
    • talismane.monitoring.default=true/false : whether individual monitors are active by default
    • talismane.monitor.[package name] : whether this whole package is active by default - sub-packages override parent package settings for their classes
    • talismane.monitor.[package + class name] : whether this specific class is active
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

      • startTask

        public void startTask(String taskName)
        Indicates that a particular task is starting. It's safest to place a try block immediately after the startTask, and place the corresponding endTask in the finally block.
        Parameters:
        taskName -

      • endTask

        public void endTask()
        Indicates that a particular task is ending. It's safest to place this in the finally block of a try block starting immediately after the corresponding startTask.
        Parameters:
        name -

        public static void end()
